_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Fill alarm at 80% with auto.  Shutoff at 85%, min. class 1 Div. 1 electric w/in 5 ft. of all transfer (truck offloading) points w/Class 1 Div. 2 from 5-15 feet, Class 1 Div. 2 w/in 15 ft. of remainder
_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: Hydrocarbon detectors, flow monitoring, temperature, pressure & liquid level indicators
_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Hydrocarbon Detectors, Alarms, Pump, Pressure Relief
_prev_prog_3.Description: Butane Blending System consisting of one (1) vessel plus lines.  Butane (liquefied and stored under pressure), is blended via direct injection into refined product (gasoline) pipelines with bulk truck offloading.  System operations are anticipated to occur primarily during the cold season.

_emerg_resp.CoordinatingAgencyName: City of Chesapeake Off. of Emg. Mgt

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Kinder Morgan Southeast Terminals LLC - Chesapeake Terminal Butane Blending System was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA Code) #58 (2011 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws/codes. It is the intent of the Chesapeake Terminal to incorporate the most recent construction and procedural guidance (NFPA # 58-2011 Edition) into this process. If an emergency were to occur, it is the facility's policy to notify the Chesapeake Fire Department as well as the City of Chesapeake Office of Emergency Management. Medical emergencies will require notification of the local Emergency Medical Services (Chesapeake Fire Department) and Sentara Norfolk General Hospital.



Kinder Morgan Southeast Terminals LLC - Chesapeake Terminal is a bulk petroleum storage and distribution facility that includes butane blending operations. This Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the butane blending system, including the associated piping and one butane storage vessel.



Kinder Morgan Southeast Terminals LLC - Chesapeake Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR Part 1910.119) along with its fourteen (14) compliance elements, and all applicable state and local laws and regulations. The butane blending system is designed, constructed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA #58 and the manufacturer (Sunoco Partners Butane Blending, LLC).



As this is a new system, this facility has never had an accident involving the butane process which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Kinder Morgan Southeast Terminals LLC - Chesapeake Terminal butane blending system, it is the pol

icy of the facility to initially contact the Chesapeake Fire Department (Primary Responder) and request their assistance. The facility emergency response plans are coordinated with fire department and the City of Chesapeake Office of Emergency Management. The Chesapeake Fire Department has participated in the initial RMP/PSM training session for this system.



Process safety controls include excess flow valves, low-melting point pneumatic valve feeds to pneumatic valves (fail closed), 85% fill shut-off (80% alarm and 90% ESD actuation) on the vessels, emergency shut-off devices on the system and video display terminal, line thermal/hydrostatic reliefs, and grounding interlock devices.



In an effort to improve and promote system safety, Kinder Morgan Southeast Terminals LLC looks for, and seeks employee input, on process safety improvements. Additionally, the Chesapeake Fire Department is contacted regarding participation in site emergency response drills. Additional actions include consolidating separate system inspection checklists for ease of completion.
